intro: Pseudognaphalium pringlei, commonly known as the Pringle's false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant produces small, yellowish to white ray flowers surrounded by a dense cluster of disk flowers. Its leaves are typically narrow, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. Pseudognaphalium pringlei is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments.
